intro: Vicia sericea, commonly known as silky vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features slender, hairy stems and trifoliate leaves with long, slender leaflets. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually pale blue or purple, and it produces slender, hairy pods that contain several seeds. Vicia sericea is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
